snippet: In the Philippines for an Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit, President Obama urged China to halt military activities on the disputed islands.
abstract: Pres Obama urges China to stop military activities in South China Sea and calls for  arbitration to settle differences between Beijing and its neighbors in Southeast Asia; demand is made at opening of Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit meeting, trade conference for regional leaders to discuss Trans-Pacific Partnership and other trade and commerce issues.
lead_paragraph: In the Philippines for an Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit, President Obama urged China to halt military activities on the disputed islands.

headline.main: Obama Calls on Beijing to Stop Construction in South China Sea
headline.print_headline: Obama Presses Beijing on Building in South China Sea

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
